meanings.definition: The time of year when crops are gathered.
meanings.sent1: During harvesttime, farmers work hard to gather all the crops.
meanings.sent2: In autumn, harvesttime is a busy period for farmers.
meanings.sent3: At harvesttime, the scarecrow decided to join the farmers in gathering the crops.
meanings.sent4: The village was bustling with activity during harvesttime, like a busy beehive.
meanings.sent5: The golden fields at harvesttime looked like a sea of waving wheat.

meanings.definition: The act or process of gathering crops.
meanings.sent1: Harvesttime involves carefully collecting the ripe fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use various tools and techniques during harvesttime to gather the crops efficiently.
meanings.sent3: During harvesttime, the mischievous rabbits tried to help with the crop gathering.
meanings.sent4: The harvesttime dance of the farmers resembled a well-coordinated symphony.
meanings.sent5: The joy of harvesttime is in the hard work and satisfaction of gathering the crops.

meanings.definition: The result or consequence of an effort or action.
meanings.sent1: After months of hard work, the successful harvesttime brought abundant crops.
meanings.sent2: The sweet fruits of labor are enjoyed during the fruitful harvesttime.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rainstorm turned the harvesttime into a muddy mess.
meanings.sent4: The harvesttime of kindness sown in the community yielded a bountiful harvest of smiles.
meanings.sent5: The harvesttime of friendship was celebrated with laughter and shared memories.
